comment.body: It's not entirely clear why you need any of this code (see comment below).

repo.name: openssl
repo.description: Fork of OpenSSL that includes prototype quantum-resistant algorithms and ciphersuites based on liboqs

comment.body: Why do you need to get a nid here? The only reason I can see is for use in the (currently commented out) Alg Id code. But that code is using OpenSSL internal APIs. That just happens to be *our* solution for creating alg ids. You might do something else (and if so there would be no need for a nid). The alg ids will ultimately be fixed strings of octets identifying the sig/md combination. There might be simpler ways to do this for your needs.

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -19,17 +21,20 @@
 #include <openssl/params.h>
 #include <openssl/evp.h>
 #include <openssl/err.h>
-#include "internal/nelem.h"
-#include "internal/packet.h"
-#include "internal/sizes.h"
-#include "internal/cryptlib.h"
-#include "prov/providercommon.h"
-#include "prov/implementations.h"
-#include "prov/providercommonerr.h"
-#include "prov/provider_ctx.h"
-#include "prov/securitycheck.h"
 #include "prov/oqsx.h"
 
+// Required OSSL internal defines: I don't think I like this...
+// TBD: Need to understand properly separated EVP use...
+#define OSSL_MAX_NAME_SIZE 50
+#define OSSL_MAX_PROPQUERY_SIZE     256 /* Property query strings */
comment.body: These are the maximum sizes that *our* providers can cope with (they're not limits imposed by OpenSSL core). You can have different limits if you choose.

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -19,17 +21,20 @@
 #include <openssl/params.h>
 #include <openssl/evp.h>
 #include <openssl/err.h>
-#include "internal/nelem.h"
-#include "internal/packet.h"
-#include "internal/sizes.h"
-#include "internal/cryptlib.h"
-#include "prov/providercommon.h"
-#include "prov/implementations.h"
-#include "prov/providercommonerr.h"
-#include "prov/provider_ctx.h"
-#include "prov/securitycheck.h"
 #include "prov/oqsx.h"
 
+// Required OSSL internal defines: I don't think I like this...
+// TBD: Need to understand properly separated EVP use...
+#define OSSL_MAX_NAME_SIZE 50
+#define OSSL_MAX_PROPQUERY_SIZE     256 /* Property query strings */
+#define OSSL_MAX_ALGORITHM_ID_SIZE  256 /* AlgorithmIdentifier DER */
+#define PROV_R_DIGEST_NOT_ALLOWED                        174
+#define PROV_R_INVALID_DIGEST                            122
comment.body:
Errors are a bit clunky at the moment - and our providers are "cheating". There's no reason why you can't define your own reason codes with your own meanings for your provider. That was the original intention. But in doing so you should not use one of the built-in OpenSSL "lib" codes. Possibly you can use `ERR_LIB_USER` which is not used internally, e.g. you might have
````
#define OQS_R_FOO_NOT_ALLOWED             1
#define OQS_R_BAR_INVALID                 2
...
ERR_raise(ERR_LIB_USER, OQS_R_FOO_NOT_ALLOWED);
````

@levitte might be able to provide some advice on how to handle error codes from 3rd party providers

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -19,17 +21,20 @@
 #include <openssl/params.h>
 #include <openssl/evp.h>
 #include <openssl/err.h>
-#include "internal/nelem.h"
-#include "internal/packet.h"
-#include "internal/sizes.h"
-#include "internal/cryptlib.h"
-#include "prov/providercommon.h"
-#include "prov/implementations.h"
-#include "prov/providercommonerr.h"
-#include "prov/provider_ctx.h"
-#include "prov/securitycheck.h"
 #include "prov/oqsx.h"
 
+// Required OSSL internal defines: I don't think I like this...
+// TBD: Need to understand properly separated EVP use...
+#define OSSL_MAX_NAME_SIZE 50
+#define OSSL_MAX_PROPQUERY_SIZE     256 /* Property query strings */
+#define OSSL_MAX_ALGORITHM_ID_SIZE  256 /* AlgorithmIdentifier DER */
comment.body: Again this is the max buffer for holding an alg id that *our* providers can handle. You can choose a different limit - and indeed that might be quite appropriate once you know what all the OIDs are for your algorithms.
